briefdescription.para: Construct a sizer item for tracking a window.

memberdef.argsstring: (wxWindow *window, int proportion=0, int flag=0, int border=0, wxObject *userData=NULL)
memberdef.name: wxSizerItem

briefdescription.para: Construct a sizer item for tracking a window.
Construct a sizer item for tracking a subsizer.

memberdef.argsstring: (wxSizer *sizer, int proportion=0, int flag=0, int border=0, wxObject *userData=NULL)
memberdef.name: wxSizerItem

briefdescription.para: Construct a sizer item for tracking a subsizer.
Set the size of the spacer tracked by this item.

detaileddescription.para: Old spacer, if any, is deleted.

briefdescription.para: Set the size of the spacer tracked by this item.

detaileddescription.para: Old spacer, if any, is deleted.

briefdescription.para: Set the ratio item attribute.
Set the ratio item attribute.
Set the ratio item attribute.

memberdef.argsstring: (int width, int height, int proportion=0, int flag=0, int border=0, wxObject *userData=NULL)
memberdef.name: wxSizerItem

briefdescription.para: Construct a sizer item for tracking a spacer.
Deletes the user data and subsizer, if any.
Set the window to be tracked by this item.

detaileddescription.para: The old window isn't deleted as it is now owned by the sizer item.

briefdescription.para: Set the sizer tracked by this item.

detaileddescription.para: Old sizer, if any, is deleted.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the minimum desired size for the item, including any space needed by borders.
Destroy the window or the windows in a subsizer, depending on the type of item.
Enable deleting the SizerItem without destroying the contained sizer.
Return the border attribute.
Return the flags attribute.

detaileddescription.para: See wxSizer flags list for details.

briefdescription.para: Return the numeric id of wxSizerItem, or wxID_NONE if the id has not been set.
Get the minimum size needed for the item.
Sets the minimum size to be allocated for this item.

detaileddescription.para: If this item is a window, the size is also passed to wxWindow::SetMinSize().

briefdescription.para: This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.
What is the current position of the item, as set in the last Layout.
Get the proportion item attribute.
Get the ration item attribute.
Get the rectangle of the item on the parent window, excluding borders.
Get the current size of the item, as set in the last Layout.
If this item is tracking a sizer, return it.
If this item is tracking a spacer, return its size.
Get the userData item attribute.
If this item is tracking a window then return it.
Returns true if this item is a window or a spacer and it is shown or if this item is a sizer and not all of its elements are hidden.

detaileddescription.para: In other words, for sizer items, all of the child elements must be hidden for the sizer itself to be considered hidden.
As an exception, if the wxRESERVE_SPACE_EVEN_IF_HIDDEN flag was used for this sizer item, then IsShown() always returns true for it (see wxSizerFlags::ReserveSpaceEvenIfHidden()).

briefdescription.para: Is this item a sizer?
Is this item a spacer?
Is this item a window?
Set the border item attribute.
Set the position and size of the space allocated to the sizer, and adjust the position and size of the item to be within that space taking alignment and borders into account.
Set the flag item attribute.
Sets the numeric id of the wxSizerItem to id.
Set the proportion item attribute.
Set the sizer tracked by this item.

xrefdescription.para: This function does not free the old sizer which may result in memory leaks, use AssignSizer() which does free it instead.

briefdescription.para: Set the size of the spacer tracked by this item.

xrefdescription.para: This function does not free the old spacer which may result in memory leaks, use AssignSpacer() which does free it instead.

briefdescription.para: Set the window to be tracked by this item.
Set the show item attribute, which sizers use to determine if the item is to be made part of the layout or not.

detaileddescription.para: If the item is tracking a window then it is shown or hidden as needed.

briefdescription.para: The wxSizerItem class is used to track the position, size and other attributes of each item managed by a wxSizer.

detaileddescription.para: It is not usually necessary to use this class because the sizer elements can also be identified by their positions or window or sizer pointers but sometimes it may be more convenient to use it directly.
